title: How to Cancel an LA Fitness Membership by Mail & More

steps.title: Log in to your LA Fitness online account.
steps.content: Log in to your LA Fitness online account. Visit https://www.lafitness.com/ and scroll over “Member Tools” in the top toolbar to bring up the dropdown menu. Click on “My LA Fitness” and enter your account details. If you don’t have an account, create one by clicking the “Create an online account” button on the bottom right of the screen. [1] X Research source When creating a new account, you’ll need to input your membership tag number, which can be found on your membership card. If you don’t know your membership tag number, ask an employee at LA Fitness to provide it to you.

steps.title: Click “Cancellation Form” and fill it out.
steps.content: Click “Cancellation Form” and fill it out. Once you get into your account details, you’ll see a link for a cancellation form on the right side of the screen. This form includes fields for all of the personal details that you provided to LA Fitness, including your name, address, and phone number. Print out the form and fill in all the fields. [2] X Research source Make sure that all the information on your cancellation form is accurate, or it could hold up the process.

steps.title: Obtain a cancellation form from an LA Fitness gym rather than online.
steps.content: Obtain a cancellation form from an LA Fitness gym rather than online. If you can’t print the form yourself or are already at the gym, obtain a cancellation form from an employee at your gym’s front desk. Simply sign in using your membership card and ask for a membership cancellation form. [3] X Research source Ask the employee any additional questions you have about the cancellation.

steps.title: Mail in your cancellation form using certified mail.
steps.content: Mail in your cancellation form using certified mail. If you send it by certified mail , you’ll receive a receipt when LA Fitness receives the form. Fold the form in half and stick it in an envelope with a stamp. Take the letter to the post office and send the form to “LA Fitness, PO Box 54170, Irvine, CA 92619-4170” using certified mail. [4] X Research source You won't receive another bill if your letter is postmarked 5 or more business days before your next billing date. If the letter is postmarked close to the billing date, you may be charged again.

steps.title: Fax your cancellation form rather than mailing it.
steps.content: Fax your cancellation form rather than mailing it. If you’re unsure of the fax number for your gym, you call your gym or ask an employee in person. Fax the completed cancellation form to the number provided to you. Make sure to save the fax receipt. The gym will then initiate the membership cancellation. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Talk to the operations manager to cancel your account in person.
steps.content: Talk to the operations manager to cancel your account in person. Visit or call the gym and ask to speak to the operations manager. Set up a time to meet with them to explain why you want to cancel and give them the cancellation form. The operations manager will then start the cancellation process. [6] X Research source Operations managers are typically available in each gym Monday to Friday from 9 am to 5 pm.

steps.title: Call customer service to verify your account has been canceled.
steps.content: Call customer service to verify your account has been canceled. Wait 48 hours for your cancellation form to be processed. Call the customer support number for your area. Ask for the number at your gym or find it on the LA Fitness website under Contact Us. Ask the customer service representative whether your account has been successfully canceled. If your account hasn’t been canceled, explain your circumstances and give them receipt numbers and dates when you submitted the form. Visit https://www.lafitness.com/Pages/ContactUs.aspx and input your zip code to find the local customer support number to check the status of your cancellation.

steps.title: Call your bank or card company if you continue to get charged.
steps.content: Call your bank or card company if you continue to get charged. If LA Fitness refuses to cancel your membership and you still can’t get hold of them, ask your bank or credit card provider to stop recurring charges on your accounts. Explain to the bank that you tried to cancel your account, but LA Fitness won’t cancel. They will stop future charges to your card from LA Fitness. [7] X Trustworthy Source US Consumer Financial Protection Bureau U.S. government agency for protecting consumers in the financial sector Go to source File a complaint with the Better Business Bureau at https://www.bbb.org/file-a-complaint .

steps.title: Consider freezing your account rather than canceling.
steps.content: Consider freezing your account rather than canceling. If you aren’t going to use your membership in the next 30 days but want to use the gym in the future, it may be worth it to freeze your account rather than cancel. Freezing your account costs $10 per month but will prevent you from having to pay start-up fees when you want to start using the gym again. [8] X Research source
